title: 易經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: Jian denotes difficulty. There is (the trigram expressive of) perilousness in front.
When one, seeing the peril, can arrest his steps (in accordance with the significance of the lower trigram), is he not wise?
(The language of) Jian, that 'advantage will be found in the south-west,' refers to the (strong fifth line) advanced and in the central place.
That 'there will be no advantage in the north-east,' intimates that the way (of dealing with the Jian state) is exhausted.
That 'it will be advantageous to see the great man,' intimates that advance will lead to achievement.

That the places (of the different lines after the first) are those appropriate to them indicates firm correctness and good fortune, with which the regions (of the kingdom) are brought to their normal state.
Great indeed is the work to be done in the time of Jian!
